title: Trainspotting
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: They try to imagine all the cocaine-crazed sex games he'll be playing with the 'manto at the Minto', as he refers to the women.

title: Letters from Thomas Percy, D.D. :
snippet: This estate of Minto, in the neighbourhood of Glasgow, was torn to pieces by adjudications, sequestrations, &c. and [[the family] is now extinct.

title: Peter's letters to his kinsfolk.
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: In many quarters, he shewed me the shields of the House of Hamilton,  and the Stewarts, Lords of Minto in which families successively was vested the regality, or lay lordship of the archiepiscopal lands shortly after the Reformation.

title: Murmurings from rugged waters.
author: Broomfield, James Polwarth. [from old catalog]
snippet: In a grove, side by side, hang the flowers o' the Border, Scott and Armstrong, Elliot o' Minto, Todd o' Tushielaw, and your brave kinsman, Kerr o' Fernieherst.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: Hehas a great respect for Minto,—I mean the judge whopresided ; and, in short, he is convinced of Alison'sguilt.
